Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Must live in township (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency that provides adoption support services.
service_description: Provides support and guidance for individuals and couples seeking international or domestic adoptions, by helping them navigate the pre-adoption process. Advocates provide information on adoption agencies, home study processes, and adoption-related laws or policies.
site_details: Visit the website www.loving-shepherd.org to fill out an assessment form. Call to request a form be mailed to you or for information
site_eligibility: Individuals or couples seeking domestic or international adoption -- In the beginning stages of the adoption process

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Wells County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Wells County, which is then used to assess taxes.  Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Wells County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Wells County residents. Regulates septic systems, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, well water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Wells County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits. Additional benefits with the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), include: Filing disability claims, checking the claim for accuracy, filing the claim with the VA regional office, tracking the claim through processing, reviewing each VA action and decision for correctness, and assisting with appeals.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

site_eligibility: Open; serves Wells County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Wells County.
service_description: Maintains the Wells County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that provides financial assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides emergency financial assistance up to two times per year for individuals and families in crisis. Depending on funds, assistance may be available for rent payment, gas, electric, and water utility bills, prescription assistance, transportation, or other emergency financial needs on a case-by-case basis. Funds are generally limited to $100; some exceptions may be considered.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail with contact information and reason for needing assistance. -- A volunteer will return calls to schedule an interview.
site_eligibility: Living in Wells County -- Not received this assistance more than twice in the past year

agency_desc: Offers practical, emotional, and spiritual support to women, men, and children of Wells County who are seeking assistance with difficulties in their daily lives.
service_name: GRACE AND MERCY TRANSITIONAL HOUSING - WOMEN
service_description: Faith-based transitional housing program that provides safe and secure housing for women and women with children.  Grace & Mercy's 9-12 month life-skill recovery program serves women  looking for re-entry from incarceration, safe housing due to domestic situations, are currently homeless, recent release from rehab, substance abuse, or those wanting a fresh start.
site_details: Call or visit the website www.cc-wc.org to fill out an application.
site_eligibility: Women 18 years or older with or without children

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Wells County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Wells County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: WELLS COUNTY CIRCUIT AND SUPERIOR COURTS
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases and traffic violations, in Wells County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. Landlord/tenant disputes must be filed in the township where the property is located. All other cases may be filed in any township in Wells County.
site_details: Walk in for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Wells County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Wells County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Wells County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Wells County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Wells County Courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing community outreach services, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Written referral required. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility:
Living in boundaries: N-Interstate 469 and Yoder Road; S-Highway 224; E-Highway 27; W-West of town of Uniondale -- Limit two visits every 30 days -- With a referral from township trustee or a pastor from one of these participating churches: Living Faith, Ossian Baptist, Ossian Methodist, Ossian Nazarene, Ossian Presbyterian, or St. Mark's Lutheran

Boundary map: https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=1ZE6_v-ZTdu4C6xLrRVSmC_M9e3xdcWo&usp=sharing

agency_name: WELLS COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: Promotes integrated solid waste management through recycling, pollution prevention and reuse in Wells County.
site_name: WELLS COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
service_description: Maintains a drop-off site in Wells County for collecting recyclables including: glass, plastics (1-7), aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans, newspapers, magazines,  plastic grocery bags (not trash bags). Does not accept Styrofoam.
site_details: Walk in to drop off approved recyclables; call or visit the website for more information -- During COVID-19 crisis remain in vechiles
site_eligibility: Open; serves Wells County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization empowering women, men, and families by offering several supportive programs.
service_description: Offers confidential pregnancy testing, negative-test referrals to medical providers, and limited ultrasounds for pregnant women. Provides positive pregnancy-test letter for obtaining health insurance, including Medicaid. Provides medical education regarding pregnancy options, referrals to parenting education programs, adoption resources, prenatal care, and community assistance programs.
site_details: Walk in or call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization empowering women, men, and families by offering several supportive programs.
service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll. Participants and qualifying partners who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of the baby's birth may each qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at a Walmart.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women (less than 34 weeks), with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit a breath/saliva test

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization empowering women, men, and families by offering several supportive programs.
service_description: Offers a support group that helps improve skills for couples or parents to connect more deeply with each other and improve their quality of life. Provides information regarding communication, conflict resolution, parenting/child rearing, and child development. Child care is provided during the group.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Group: Thurs 7pm -- Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open
